name: Pulse Oximeter
specification: Finger sensor using red and infrared LEDs; digital LED display showing oxygen saturation (SpO2) and pulse rate; battery powered; lightweight and portable.
function: Measures arterial oxygen saturation and pulse rate by analyzing light absorption through the skin, typically on the fingertip, without entering the body.
usage: Place sensor clip securely on the patient's finger ensuring good contact; wait for display stabilization; record readings; remove and turn off after use.
maintenance: Clean and disinfect sensor and device after each use; check and replace batteries as necessary; inspect sensor for damage regularly.
warning: Poor sensor contact, cold extremities, or excessive movement can lead to inaccurate readings; always verify with clinical assessment.
